alert.note: Alert for St. Louis; St. Louis City (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 31 at 7:36PM CDT until March 31 at 8:15PM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: The National Weather Service in St Louis has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Bond County in south central Illinois... Northwestern Monroe County in southwestern Illinois... Madison County in southwestern Illinois... Southeastern Macoupin County in southwestern Illinois... Montgomery County in south central Illinois... Northern St. Clair County in southwestern Illinois... St. Louis City in east central Missouri... Southeastern St. Louis County in east central Missouri... * Until 815 PM CDT. * At 736 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Eagarville to Edwardsville to East Carondelet, moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Severe thunderstorms will be near... Gillespie, Mount Olive, Benld, Sawyerville, Mount Clare, East Gillespie and Eagarville around 740 PM CDT. Litchfield and Carpenter around 745 PM CDT. Belleville, Collinsville, Fairview Heights, Swansea, Shiloh, Hillsboro, Caseyville, Worden, Marine and Taylor Springs around 750 PM CDT. O`Fallon, Highland, Coffeen and Schram City around 755 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these severe thunderstorms include Lebanon, Scott AFB, Witt, Pocahontas, Nokomis, St. Jacob, Sorento, Reno, Greenville, Woburn and Van Burensburg. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Illinois between exits 21 and 41. Interstate 55 in Illinois between exits 23 and 63. Interstate 64 in Illinois between exits 9 and 27. This also includes Scott Joplin Historic Site, Lake Lou Yaeger, and Horseshoe Lake State Park. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for south central and southwestern Illinois...and east central Missouri. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for south central and southwestern Illinois...and east central Missouri.
